alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LEWIS AND SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Tollesboro, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Vanceburg, Head of Grassy, Camp Dix, Rome, Concord, Sandy Springs, Carrs, Harris, Kinniconick, Tannery, Emerson, Ribolt, Charters, Garrison, Petersville, Stricklett, Glen Springs, Rexton and Herron Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
